name: chk files
func:
from os import listdir

basedir = '/home/pi/OpenScan/settings/'

msg['payload'] = ''

files = listdir(basedir)

for i in msg['settings']:
    if msg['overwrite'] != True:
        if i not in files:
            with open(basedir + i, 'w+') as file:
                file.write(str(msg['settings'][i]))        
    else:
        with open(basedir + i, 'w+') as file:
            file.write(str(msg['settings'][i])) 

msg['payload'] = True

return msg

name: create log
func:
import subprocess
from time import sleep
sleep(20)


log = '############################################DMESG############################################\n'
log += subprocess.getoutput("dmesg")
log += '\n############################################SYSLOG############################################\n'
log += subprocess.getoutput("tail -10000 /var/log/syslog")

with open('/home/pi/OpenScan/tmp/log.txt', 'w+') as file:
    file.write(log)

return msg

name: first start
format:
Initial Setup

Note, that you can always adjust these and other settings in the settings menu, which will appear after this setup stage. 

Model

Please select the OpenScan Version - this will only affect the motor settings (acceleration, gear ratio, speed).

Camera

- Pi Camera v1, v2, HQ, Arducam IMX519, IMX290, IMX378, OV9281 are connected through the ribbon cable. If you encounter any issues, please check the cable's orientation

- DSLR (gphoto) - can be used with a wide range of cameras, which can be connected and controlled via USB. Check GPhoto if your camera is supported

- External Camera - Can be used to connect your camera trigger to the GPIO pins on the front of the pi shield. This can be used with any (modified) remote shutter release, and thus it is possible to use Smartphones, DSLR and compact cameras

name: rescue incomplete project

from os import system
from os.path import isfile
from time import strftime
from OpenScan import load_str

basepath = '/home/pi/OpenScan/'
zippath = basepath + 'tmp/tmp.zip'
projectname=load_str("routine_projectname")
projectcode = strftime('20%y-%m-%d_%H.%M.%S-') + projectname

if isfile(zippath):
    system('mv '+ zippath + ' ' + basepath + 'scans/' + projectcode + '.zip')

name: write
LED
func:
from OpenScan import ringlight
val = msg['payload']

if val == 0:
    ringlight(1,False)
    ringlight(2,False)
elif val == 1:
    ringlight(1,False)
    ringlight(2,True)
elif val == 2:
    ringlight(1,True)
    ringlight(2,False)
elif val == 3:
    ringlight(1,True)
    ringlight(2,True)

name: inactive
func:
from requests import get
from OpenScan import load_int

timeout = load_int('timeout_ringlight')

msg['cmd'] = 'get'

try:
    flask = 'http://127.0.0.1:1312/ping'
    r = get(flask, params=msg)

    idle = float(r.text.split(":")[1].split('}')[0])

    msg['payload'] = idle

    if idle > timeout:
        return msg,msg
except:
    pass

return None,msg

name: global
func:
focus = global.get('focus')
focus1 = global.get('focus1')
focus2 = global.get('focus2')

msg.payload = 0
msg.enabled = false

if (focus1 == 0 && focus2==0){
    global.set('focus1', focus)
    global.set('stacksize', 0)

    msg.value1=global.get('focus1')
    msg.value2="n.def."
    msg.focuslabel = "SET Focus2"

    return msg
}
if (focus1 !=0 && focus2 ==0 && focus1!=focus){
    global.set('focus2', focus)
    msg.value1=global.get('focus1')
    msg.value2=global.get('focus2')
    msg.enabled = true
    msg.payload = 2
    msg.focuslabel = "RESET Focus"
    return msg

}

if (focus1 !=0 && focus2 !=0){
    global.set('focus1', 0)
    global.set('focus2', 0)
    global.set('stacksize', 0)

    msg.value1 = ' '
    msg.value2 = ' '
    msg.focuslabel = "SET Focus "
    msg.enabled = false
    msg.payload = 2

    return msg
}

name: Routine_save
func:
from OpenScan import load_bool, load_str, load_int, load_float, motorrun, create_coordinates, take_photo, save, load_bool, camera
from time import sleep, strftime, time
from zipfile import ZipFile, ZIP_DEFLATED
from os import system
from os.path import isfile
from Arducam import Focuser

if load_str("status_internal_cam")=="no camera found" or load_str("status_internal_cam")[:5]=="Featu":
    return

save('status_internal_cam','Routine-preparing')
camera('/picam2_switch_mode?mode=1')

projectname=load_str("routine_projectname")
photocount = load_int('routine_photocount') #vorher point_count
angle_max = load_int('rotor_anglemax')
angle_min = load_int('rotor_anglemin')
angle_start = load_int('rotor_anglestart')
tt_mode = load_bool('turntable_mode')
cam_delay_before = load_float("cam_delay_before")
cam_delay_after = load_float("cam_delay_after")

STmode = False

if msg['stacksize'] != 0:
    stacksize = msg['stacksize']
    focus1 = msg['focus1']
    focus2 = msg['focus2']
    if focus1 > focus2:
        focus2 = focus1
        focus1 = msg['focus2']
    focusstep = (focus2-focus1)/(stacksize - 1)
    STmode = True

counter = 0
basepath = '/home/pi/OpenScan/'
temppath = basepath + 'tmp2/preview.jpg'
zippath = basepath + 'tmp.zip'

projectcode = strftime('20%y-%m-%d_%H.%M.%S-') + projectname
if isfile(zippath):
    system('rm ' + zippath)
sleep(1)

if tt_mode == False:
    coordinates = create_coordinates(angle_min,angle_max,photocount)
else:
    angle_start = 0
    coordinates = []
    for i in range (photocount):
        coordinates.append([0,360/photocount*(i+1)])

position_last = (angle_start , 0)

zip = ZipFile(zippath, "a",ZIP_DEFLATED, allowZip64=True)

starttime = time()


for position in coordinates:
    counter += 1
    if load_str('status_internal_cam') == "Routine-stopping":
        break

    filepath = basepath + 'tmp/' + projectname + '_' + str(counter) + ".jpg"

    rotor_angle = position_last[0] - position[0]
    if abs(rotor_angle) > 180:
        rotor_angle = -360 * rotor_angle/abs(rotor_angle) + rotor_angle
    tt_angle = position_last[1] - position[1]
    if tt_angle > 180:
        tt_angle -= 360
    elif tt_angle < -180:
        tt_angle += 360
        
    motorrun('rotor', rotor_angle)
    motorrun('tt', tt_angle)
    sleep(cam_delay_before)

    if load_str('status_internal_cam') == "Routine-stopping":
        break

    if counter < 6:
        ETA = ''
    if STmode == True:
        counter2 = 0
        for focus in range (stacksize):
            counter2 += 1
            camera('/picam2_focus?focus=' + str(focus1 + focus * focusstep))
            camera('/picam2_take_photo')
            if load_str('status_internal_cam') == "Routine-stopping":
                break
            save('status_internal_cam','Routine-' + str(counter) + '/' + str(photocount) + ' F' + str(counter2) + ETA)
            zip.write(temppath, projectname + '_' + str(counter) + '-' + str(focus) + ".jpg")
    else:
        save('status_internal_cam','Routine-Photo ' + str(counter) + '/' + str(photocount) + ETA)
        camera('/picam2_take_photo')
        zip.write(temppath, projectname + '_' + str(counter) + ".jpg")
    ETA = '-ETA:'+str(int((photocount/counter - 1)*(time() - starttime)))+'/'+str(int(photocount/counter*(time() - starttime)))+'s'
    sleep(cam_delay_after)
    position_last = position

zip.close()
camera('/picam2_switch_mode?mode=0')

save('status_internal_cam','Routine-done')

motorrun('rotor',position_last[0] - angle_start)
motorrun('tt',position_last[1])

save('status_internal_cam','--READY--')

system('mv ' + zippath + " " + basepath + "scans/" + projectcode + ".zip" )

return msg

name: Routine_thread
func:
from OpenScan import load_bool, load_str, load_int, load_float, motorrun, create_coordinates, take_photo, save, load_bool, camera
from time import sleep, strftime, time
from zipfile import ZipFile, ZIP_DEFLATED
from os import system
from os.path import isfile
import threading

if load_str("status_internal_cam")=="no camera found" or load_str("status_internal_cam")[:5]=="Featu":
    return

save('status_internal_cam','Routine-preparing')
camera('/picam2_switch_mode?mode=1')

projectname=load_str("routine_projectname")
photocount = load_int('routine_photocount') #vorher point_count
angle_max = load_int('rotor_anglemax')
angle_min = load_int('rotor_anglemin')
angle_start = load_int('rotor_anglestart')
tt_mode = load_bool('turntable_mode')

STmode = False

if msg['stacksize'] != 0 and msg['focus1']!=0 and msg['focus1']!=msg['focus2'] :
    stacksize = msg['stacksize']
    focus1 = msg['focus1']
    focus2 = msg['focus2']
    if focus1 > focus2:
        focus2 = focus1
        focus1 = msg['focus2']
    focusstep = (focus2-focus1)/(stacksize - 1)
    STmode = True

counter = 0
basepath = '/home/pi/OpenScan/'
temppath = basepath + 'tmp2/preview.jpg'
zippath = basepath + 'tmp.zip'

projectcode = strftime('20%y-%m-%d_%H.%M.%S-') + projectname
if isfile(zippath):
    system('rm ' + zippath)
sleep(1)

if tt_mode == False:
    coordinates = create_coordinates(angle_min,angle_max,photocount)
else:
    angle_start = 0
    coordinates = []
    for i in range (photocount):
        coordinates.append([0,360/photocount*(i+1)])

position_last = (angle_start , 0)

zip = ZipFile(zippath, "a",ZIP_DEFLATED, allowZip64=True)

starttime = time()

def f1():
    save('status_internal_cam','Routine-Photo ' + str(counter) + '/' + str(photocount) + ETA)
    camera('/picam2_take_photo')
    zip.write(temppath, projectname + '_' + str(counter) + ".jpg")    

def f2():
    counter2 = 0
    for focus in range (stacksize):
        counter2 += 1
        camera('/picam2_focus?focus=' + str(focus1 + focus * focusstep))
        camera('/picam2_take_photo')
        if load_str('status_internal_cam') == "Routine-stopping":
            break
        save('status_internal_cam','Routine-' + str(counter) + '/' + str(photocount) + ' F' + str(counter2) + ETA)
        zip.write(temppath, projectname + '_' + str(counter) + '-' + str(focus) + ".jpg")

def f3():
    rotor_angle = position_last[0] - position[0]
    if abs(rotor_angle) > 180:
        rotor_angle = -360 * rotor_angle/abs(rotor_angle) + rotor_angle
    tt_angle = position_last[1] - position[1]
    if tt_angle > 180:
        tt_angle -= 360
    elif tt_angle < -180:
        tt_angle += 360

    motorrun('tt', tt_angle)
#    motorrun('tt', 90)
    
    motorrun('rotor', rotor_angle)

for position in coordinates:
    counter += 1
    if load_str('status_internal_cam') == "Routine-stopping":
        break

    filepath = basepath + 'tmp/' + projectname + '_' + str(counter) + ".jpg"

    if load_str('status_internal_cam') == "Routine-stopping":
        break

    if counter < 6:
        ETA = ''
    if STmode == True:
        f2()
        t1 = threading.Thread(target=time) #helper
    else:
        t1 = threading.Thread(target=f1)

    t2 = threading.Thread(target=f3)
    t1.start()
    sleep(load_float("cam_delay_before"))
    t2.start()
    t1.join()
    t2.join()
    sleep(load_float("cam_delay_after"))



    ETA = '-ETA:'+str(int((photocount/counter - 1)*(time() - starttime)))+'/'+str(int(photocount/counter*(time() - starttime)))+'s'
    position_last = position

zip.close()
camera('/picam2_switch_mode?mode=0')

save('status_internal_cam','Routine-done')

motorrun('rotor',position_last[0] - angle_start)
motorrun('tt',position_last[1])

save('status_internal_cam','--READY--')

system('mv ' + zippath + " " + basepath + "scans/" + projectcode + ".zip" )

return msg

name: focus
func:
import math
from time import time, sleep
from OpenScan import camera

distance = msg['payload'] 

focus = math.pow(distance/737086, -1/1.4096)/273

camera('/picam2_focus?focus=' + str(focus))

msg['payload'] = focus

return msg

name: focus
func:
import math
from time import sleep 
sleep(1)
focus = msg['payload'] * 273 
distance = 737086 * math.pow(focus, -1.4096)
msg['payload'] = distance
return msg

name: get dirs
func: from glob import glob import os from zipfile import ZipFile from datetime import datetime from PIL import Image def set_stats(stat): try: with open(directory+set[:-4]+"/"+stat,"r") as file: stat=file.read() except: stat="" return stat table=[] directory="/home/pi/OpenScan/scans/" for d in glob(directory+"*.zip"): set=os.path.basename(d) try: with ZipFile(d, 'r') as f: photos = len(f.namelist()) if not os.path.isfile(directory + 'preview/' + os.path.basename(d)[:-4]+'.jpg'): image = f.open(f.namelist()[int(photos/2)]) img = Image.open(image) width, height = img.size width_factor = width/300 height_factor = height/295 if height_factor>=width_factor and height_factor > 1: new_size=(int(width/height_factor), int(height/height_factor)) img = img.resize(new_size) elif height_factor 1: new_size=(int(width/width_factor),int(height/width_factor)) img = img.resize(new_size) img.save(directory + 'preview/' + os.path.basename(d)[:-4] +'.jpg') list=[] for fi in f.filelist: list.append(f.getinfo(fi.filename).date_time) duration = str(datetime(*max(list)) - datetime(*min(list))) size = float(int(float(os.path.getsize(d))/100000))/10 size_full= os.path.getsize(d) status=set_stats("status") expiration=set_stats("expiration") download=set_stats("download") if len(download)!=0: table.append({ "Set":set, "Photos":photos, "Size":str(size)+"MB", "Date":set[:16], "Name":(set[20:-4]), "Status":status, "Download":"RESULT", "Size_full":size_full, "Duration":duration, }) else: table.append({ "Set":set, "Photos":photos, "Size":str(size)+"MB", "Date":set[:16], "Name":(set[20:-4]), "Status":status, "Size_full":size_full, "Duration":duration, }) except: pass msg['payload']=table msg['topic']="" return msg

name: upload
func:
import os
from OpenScan import OpenScanCloud, load_str, load_int, save
from subprocess import getoutput

basedir = '/home/pi/OpenScan/'

if load_str("feedback_terms")=="False":
    msg['payload']="Please read and agree to the Terms of Use (See Settings Menu) before you can use the OpenScanCloud"
    msg['topic'] = 'OpenScanCloud - Terms of Use'
    return None,msg

msg = msg['payload']

def upload(filelist, ulinks):
    pid = getoutput('pidof curl')
    if pid != "":
        os.system('kill ' + pid)

    i = 0
    for file in filelist:
        link = ulinks[i]
        save('status_cloud', 'uploading ' + str(i+1) + '/' + str(len(filelist)))
        cmd = 'curl -# -X POST ' + link + ' --header Content-Type:application/octet-stream --data-binary @"' + file + '" 2>&1 | tee /home/pi/OpenScan/settings/status_uploadprogress'
        i = i+1
        os.system(cmd)

########
if not os.path.isfile(basedir + 'settings/token'):
    msg['flag'] = True
    save('status_cloud', 'please enter token first')
    return msg
with open(basedir + 'settings/token', 'r') as file:
    token = file.read().strip('\n')

########
r = OpenScanCloud('getTokenInfo', {'token':token})

if r.status_code == 400:
    msg['topic'] = 'Invalid Token'
    msg['payload'] = 'Please enter a valid token (settings --> OpenScanCloud)'
    save('status_cloud', 'invalid/missing token')
    return None,msg
elif r.status_code == 200:
    pass
else:
    msg['topic'] = 'Connection Error'
    msg['payload'] = 'Not able to establish a connection to OpenScanCloud.'
    return None,msg

msg1 = r.json()

########
if msg['Photos'] > msg1['limit_photos'] or msg['Size_full'] > msg1['limit_filesize']:
    msg['flag'] = True
    save('status_cloud', 'limit(s) exceeded')
    return msg

########
temp =  OpenScanCloud('getProjectInfo', {'token':token, 'project':msg['Set']})
if temp.status_code not in (200,401):
    msg['topic'] = 'Connection to OpenScanCloud failed'
    msg['payload'] = 'Please check your internet connection'
    return None,msg

if temp.status_code != 401:
    temp = temp.json()
    if 'status' in temp:
        if temp['status'] != 'created':
            save('status_cloud','already exists')
            with open(basedir + 'scans/' + msg['Set'][:-4] + '/status', 'w') as file:
                file.write(temp['status'])
            return msg
#####

msg2={}
msg2['token'] = token
msg2['parts'] = 1
msg['partslist']=[]

#######
size_to_split = load_int('osc_splitsize')

if msg['Size_full'] > size_to_split:
    tempdir = basedir + 'tmp/split/'
    if os.path.isdir(tempdir):
        os.system('rm -r ' + tempdir)
    os.mkdir(tempdir)
    save('status_cloud', 'zipping files, please wait ...')
    cmd = 'split -b ' + str(size_to_split) + ' ' + basedir + 'scans/' + msg['Set'] + ' ' + tempdir + msg['Set']
    os.system(cmd)
    save('status_cloud', 'zip done')
    list = os.listdir(tempdir)
    for l in list:
        msg['partslist'].append(tempdir + l)
        msg['partslist'].sort()
    msg2['parts']=len(msg['partslist'])
else:
    msg['partslist'] = [basedir + 'scans/' +msg['Set']]

#######
msg2['photos'] = msg['Photos']
msg2['filesize'] = msg['Size_full']
msg2['project'] = msg['Set']

r = OpenScanCloud('createProject', msg2)
if r.status_code != 200:
    msg['topic'] = 'Connection to OpenScanCloud failed'
    msg['payload'] = 'Please check your internet connection'
    return None,msg

msg1 = r.json()

if not os.path.isdir(basedir+ 'scans/' + msg['Set'][:-4]):
    os.mkdir(basedir+ 'scans/' + msg['Set'][:-4])
with open(basedir+ 'scans/' + msg['Set'][:-4]+'/status', 'w+') as file:
    file.write('prepared')

save('status_cloud', 'uploading')
upload(msg['partslist'], msg1['ulink'])

r = OpenScanCloud('startProject', msg2)
if r.status_code != 200:
    msg['topic'] = 'Upload failed'
    msg['payload'] = 'please try again'
    save('status_cloud', 'upload failed')
    return None,msg

save('status_cloud', 'uploaded')

save('status_cloud', 'project started')

try:
    os.system('rm -r ' + tempdir)
except:
    pass

return msg

name: refresh
func:
from time import sleep
import os
from OpenScan import load_str, OpenScanCloud, save, load_bool

basepath = '/home/pi/OpenScan/scans/'

if load_bool("terms")==False:
    msg['payload']="Please read and agree to the Terms of Use (See Settings Menu) before you can use the OpenScanCloud"
    msg['topic']='OpenScanCloud - Terms of Use'
    return None,msg

save('status_cloud','refreshing')
token = load_str('token')

test = OpenScanCloud('getTokenInfo',{'token':token})
if test.status_code == 400:
    msg['topic'] = 'Invalid Token'
    msg['payload'] = 'Please enter a valid token (settings --> OpenScanCloud)'
    return None,msg
elif test.status_code == 200:
    pass
else:
    msg['topic'] = 'Connection Error'
    msg['payload'] = 'Not able to establish a connection to OpenScanCloud.'
    return None,msg

stats = test.json()
for i in stats:
    save('osc_'+i, stats[i])
    pass

msg={}
projects = []
for i in os.listdir(basepath):
    if i == 'preview':
        continue
    if os.path.isdir(basepath + i):
        if os.path.isfile(basepath + i + '/status'):
            with open(basepath + i + '/status', 'r') as file:
                status = file.read().strip('\n')
                if status in ['expired', 'processing done', 'processing failed']:
                    continue
        projects.append(i)

for p in projects:
    r = OpenScanCloud('getProjectInfo',{'token':token, 'project':p+'.zip'})
    if r.status_code == 200:
        answer = r.json()
        if answer == {}:
            os.system('rm -r ' + basepath + p)
        else:
            with open(basepath + p + '/status', 'w+') as file:
                file.write(answer['status'])
            with open(basepath + p + '/download', 'w+') as file:
                file.write(answer['dlink'])

msg['list'] = projects
sleep(0.5)
save('status_cloud','ready')
return msg, None

name: combine
func:
from os.path import getsize
from shutil import copy
from os import rename, remove
import zipfile as z
from OpenScan import save

from time import sleep

if msg['payload'] != 'OK':
    return

basepath = '/home/pi/OpenScan/scans/'
tmp1 = basepath + msg['set1']
tmp2 = basepath + msg['set2']

if getsize(tmp1) > getsize(tmp2):
    set1 = tmp1
    set2 = tmp2
else:
    set1 = tmp2
    set2 = tmp1

zips = [set1, set2]

with z.ZipFile(set1, 'a') as z1:
    z2 = z.ZipFile(set2, 'r')
    i = 0
    for n in z2.namelist():
        i += 1
        n2 = n
        save('status_cloud','writing ' + str(i) + '/' + str(len(z2.namelist())))
        while 'X'+n in z1.namelist():
            n = 'X' + n
        z1.writestr('X'+n, z2.open(n2).read())
save('status_cloud','ready')

os.rename(set1, set1[:-4] + 'X.zip')
os.remove(set2)

return msg

name: diskspace
func:
from subprocess import getoutput
from OpenScan import load_int

diskspace_threshold = load_int('diskspace_threshold')

diskspace = getoutput('df -h / | awk "{print $5}"').split('\n')[1]

available = int(float(diskspace.replace(' ','').split('G')[2])*1000)


if available < diskspace_threshold:
    msg['topic'] = 'Low diskspace remaining! ('+str(available)+'MB)' 
    msg['payload'] = 'Please delete some/all locally stored files.'
    msg['color'] = 'red'
    return msg

name: read
func:
from OpenScan import load_str
from os import listdir, path

status = load_str('status_cloud')

if status[0:9] == 'uploading':
    progress = load_str('status_uploadprogress')[-6:]
    if progress[-1:] == '%':
        status = status + ' (' + progress + ')'

if status[0:7] == 'zipping':
    path1 = '/home/pi/OpenScan/tmp/split/'
    files = listdir(path1)
    size1 = 0
    for file in files:
        size1 += path.getsize(path1+file)
    size2 = path.getsize('/home/pi/OpenScan/scans/'+ files[0][:-2])
    
    status = 'zipping files (' + str(float(int(1000*size1/size2))/10) + '%)'

msg['status'] = status
return msg

name: ssh
Wifi
payload:
Network Settings

Hostname

The device can be accessed through any browser in the same network. Therefore, you can either enter the device's IP address or the given hostname. The standard name is 'openscan' but it is highly recommended to change the name, when using multiple devices (e.g. 'openscan1', 'openscan2' ...)

Select Wifi

After booting, the device will automatically search for available wireless networks and create a list. You can connect to a given network by entering the wifi password and country code. To find the right two-character country code, see the following list: ISO 3166 Country Code on Wikipedia

Search Wifi

You can manually refresh the list of available networks by pressing this button.

Reset Wifi

Delete the list of known wireless networks (and passwords) and reset the default. After this step, you will either need to use Ethernet or a modified wpa_supplicant.conf file. (see glennklockwood.com for more details about the wpa_supplicant.conf file, which has to be manually created and placed into the /boot/ directory of the sd-card)

name: General
payload:
General Settings

Terms Of Use

In order to use the OpenScanCloud, please read the terms of use as files will be transmitted from your device to the OpenScan Servers.

SSH

SSH can be used to access the Raspberry Pi and modify core files of the operating system. Please deactivate, if you do not want to use this feature.

If you want to use it, the default user is pi, password: raspberry. Please change the password immediately. 

Samba

Samba s a network local file sharing server, which allows accessing the Raspberry Pi's file system through the explorer (and other programs like FileZilla). You can use it to transfer custom photo sets to the device in order to use the OpenScanCloud. Therefore, you need to transfer the zip file containing your photos to the following folder /OpenScan/scans/

You can access the Raspberry Pis file system by inserting the following line into your Windows explorer: 

\\OpenScan/PiShare/OpenScan/scans/

username: pi, password: raspberry

Please deactivate the local file sharing if you do not intend to use it

Advanced Settings

Enable a ton of additional settings, which should be changed only if you know what you are doing ;)

Model

Device model you are using: OpenScan Mini or OpenScan Classic. Setting the device affects the settings of the motor (gear ratio, acceleration, speed). You can change those values manually in the advanced settings.

Camera

A wide range of camera modules is supported (Pi camera v1.3, v2.1, HQ, Arducam IMX519, IMX290, IMX378, OV9281). If you encounter any issues with those models, please check the orientation of the camera ribbon cable and its connectors.

DSLR (gphoto) - connect a wide range of DSLR cameras to the device through USB. See GPhoto for a full list of supported devices.

External camera - triggering any camera through an isolated GPIO signal on the front side of the pi shield.

Shutdown/Reboot

Always use the shutdown button before you power off your Raspberry Pi.

Restore Default Settings

In case you want to restore the default settings

name: Pinout
payload:
Pinout

ONLY CHANGE THE PINOUT IF YOU ARE ABSOLUTELY SURE! CHANGES CAN DAMAGE THE RASPBERRY PI AND ANY PERIPHERALS!

name: Motor
payload:
Motor Settings

Turntable Mode

Activate turntable mode in order to deactivate the rotor. The routine will only move the turntable and take a given number of photos.

Rotor - Start Angle, Min and Max Angle

Since this version of OpenScan does not have an endstop (yet), it is necessary to tell the device its position when the routine is being started. 0° corresponds to the horizontal (natural) orientation.

After that, the device will equally space the image positions between angle min and angle max.

Rotor/Turntable

Steps per rotation -  defines the number of steps it takes to move the axis 360°. It is defined by A*B*C, where A is the number of steps for one revolution of the given stepper motor (normally 200), B is the microstepping used (normally 16), and C the gear ratio (1 for the turntable and 15 or 5,33 for the OpenScan Mini and Classic respectively)

Delay - time in microseconds between each step of the motor. Lower this value if the movement is too fast

Acceleration - a factor defining how fast the delay time between each step is being changed during acceleration and deceleration phases. Lower this value in order to make the movement smoother.

Acceleration ramp - the number of steps allowed for the acceleration processes. Increase this value, if you want smoother movement.

Manual Angle - Defines the degree value for the manual movement through the arrow buttons in the scan menu

Direction - If needed, reverse the movement (in case the arrow buttons and movement do not correspond). Alternatively, you can flip the motor cable 180° (BUT MAKE SURE TO POWER OFF THE DEVICE!)

name: camera
payload:
Camera Settings

Jpeg quality

Value in percent, which usually does not need to be changed.

Downscale Preview

The preview image has to be scaled down depending on your network speed. If you want to have a higher quality preview image, you can increase this value, which defines the maximal width/height value. If the value is too high, the preview window might not update

Image Rotation

Change the image rotation, if needed.

Timeout

Defines the time in seconds, when the libcamera command (used for the camera modules) will timeout. Increase this value, if the camera does not get triggered in each position.

Delay Before/After

A fixed delay in seconds before and/or after a photo is taken. Increase this value when the photos have visual motion blur.

AWBG, Gain, Contrast, Saturation

Under most circumstances, you do not need to touch these values.

from OpenScan import load_str, save

state = msg['payload']
msg['state'] = state

if state != load_str('model'):
    save('model', state)
    if state == 'OSMini':
        save('rotor_stepsperrotation',48000)
        save('cam_rotation',90)
        save('rotor_anglemin',-70)
        save('rotor_anglemax',20)
        

    if state == 'OSClassic':
        save('rotor_stepsperrotation',17067)
        save('cam_rotation',0)
        save('rotor_anglemin',-30)
        save('rotor_anglemax',30)

if state == "OSMini":
    msg['crop2'] = 'Crop X (%)'
    msg['crop1'] = 'Crop Y (%)'
elif state == "OSClassic":
    msg['crop1'] = 'Crop X (%)'
    msg['crop2'] = 'Crop Y (%)'

return msg

name: Reset Wifi
func:
from time import sleep

if msg['payload']!="Yes":
    return

temp_dir = '/home/pi/OpenScan/tmp/wpa_empty.log'
wpa_dir = '/etc/wpa_supplicant/wpa_supplicant.conf'

with open(temp_dir, 'w+') as file:
    file.write('update_config=1\nctrl_interface=DIR=/var/run/wpa_supplicant\ncountry=de\n\n')
os.system('mv '+ temp_dir + ' ' + wpa_dir)
os.system('wpa_cli -i wlan0 reconfigure')
sleep(3)
os.system('systemctl restart nodered')
return msg

name: msg
func: if msg['payload'] == 'Cancel': return msg['password'] = msg['payload'] msg['payload']='Enter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2, see: Wikipedia)' return msg

name: modWPA
func:
if msg['payload'] == 'Cancel':
    return

if len(msg['payload'])!=2:
    msg['payload'] = 'invalid country code'
    return msg,None

wpa_dir = '/etc/wpa_supplicant/wpa_supplicant.conf'

temp_dir = '/home/pi/OpenScan/tmp/wpa'

code = msg['payload'].upper()
ssid = msg['ssid']
password = msg['password']

if len(code) != 2:
    msg['topic'] = 'ERROR'
    msg['payload'] = 'invalid country code (see  ISO 3166-1 alpha-2)'
    return msg

with open(wpa_dir, 'r') as file:
    for i in file.readlines():
        if 'country=' in i:
            code_old=i.split('country=')[1][0:2]
            break

with open(wpa_dir, 'r') as file:
    wpa = file.read()
    if ssid in wpa:
        msg['topic'] = 'ERROR'
        msg['payload'] = 'Network already exists! If you have trouble connecting, please consider resetting the saved Wifi connections.'
        return msg
    wpa=wpa.replace('country=' + code_old, 'country=' + code)
    wpa=wpa + '\nnetwork={\n priority=10\n ssid="'+ssid+'"\n psk="'+password+'"\n}\n'

with open(temp_dir,'w+') as file:
    file.write(wpa)
os.system('mv '+temp_dir + ' ' + wpa_dir)

msg['topic'] = 'Updating Wifi'
msg['payload'] = 'reconnecting might take a moment'
return msg,msg

name: Cloud-settings
payload:
OpenScanCloud

OpenScanCloud is a free/donation-based cloud processing service, which will convert your photos into 3d models using latest photogrammetry technology. Feel free to support the project with a small donation at BuyMeACoffee.

The only requirement to use this service is a one-time, free-of-charge registration (which is solely an anti-spam measure). By filling out the registration form, you will receive an individual access token.

Register

In order to use the OpenScanCloud, you will have to enter your name and email. It might take 1-3 days to create the access token, which will be sent to your mail address. Please check your spam folder.

Enter Token

Please enter your individual token here in order to activate the cloud functionality. The token will be verified immediately. In case of any problems, please contact cloud@openscan.eu

Token

A shorted version of your token will be displayed here. Please include a copy of this shorted token in any support requests cloud@openscan.eu

Credit (GB)

Each token comes with a given amount of 'credit' which is another measure against spam. The given number in Gigabyte indicates the amount of data, that you can process on the servers. 

IMPORTANT: The credit can be increased at any time by sending a (nice) mail to cloud@openscan.eu

name: save
func:
import requests
import os
from OpenScan import save, OpenScanCloud

if msg['payload']!="Yes":
    return None,msg

try:
    r = OpenScanCloud('getTokenInfo', {'token':msg['token']})
    if r.status_code != 200:
        msg['payload'] = 'Could not verify token'
        return msg 
    
    msg1 = r.json()
    
    save('osc_credit',msg1['credit'])
    save('osc_limit_filesize',msg1['limit_filesize'])
    save('osc_limit_photos',msg1['limit_photos'])
    msg1['enabled'] = True
except:
    pass

save('token',msg['token'])
    
msg['payload'] = 'Token verified and saved'
return msg, msg1

import re

mail = msg['payload']

if email_regex.match(mail) != None:
    msg['mail'] = mail
    msg['topic'] = 'OpenScanCloud Registration (2/3)'
    msg['payload'] = 'Enter your first name'
    return msg
msg['payload'] = 'invalid input'

msg['topic'] = 'OpenScanCloud Registration - Success'

    msg['topic'] = 'OpenScanCloud Registration - Failed'
    msg['payload'] = 'Registration failed, please try again.'

msg['status'] = status

return msg

msg.payload = 'This is a free piece of software and it is provided as is, without any warranty.
There might be functions that need a connection to the internet: '+ '

By pressing GET FEATURES you agree that the shown preview image will be transfered, stored and processed via SFTP to my servers '+ '(Thomas Megel, OpenScan, Halle, Germany). The IP address will be saved for 14 days The images might be used for further experiments (e.g. machine learning, automation ...). '+ '

By entering a token and/or pressing UPLOAD, the device will create a connection to my servers, where the associated user information is stored (token, email, name, credit, limit_photos, limit_filesize)'+ 'The selected image set will be uploaded to Dropbox Inc via one-time temporary upload link. The files will be saved on Dropbox Inc. for a maximum of 7 days. (+the time Dropbox Inc. will need to delete the files permanently)'+ 'Processing will be done on my local servers, where the images get downloaded from Dropbox and processed on my workstations. The resulting 3D model will be uploaded to Dropbox and a link will be created and send to your email address from my google mail account.'+ '

By uploading data to my servers, you agree, that I can use those images and derived 3d models for further research and to improve my services.'+ 'The raw images and resulting 3d models will never be published without your explicit consent.'+ '

If you have any questions you can contact me at info@openscan.eu.'+ '

THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED AS IS WITHOUT '+ 'WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, TITLE'+ 'AND NON-INFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS OR ANYONE DISTRIBUTING THE SOFTWARE BE LIABLE FOR ANY DAMAGES OR OTHER LIABILITY,'+ 'WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE SOFTWARE'; return msg

name: msg
func:
ssid = msg.payload
msg.topic = 'Add wifi network (' + ssid + ')'
msg.payload = 'Enter Wifi password:'
msg.ssid = ssid

return msg

name: chk/change hostname
func:
from OpenScan import save

if msg['payload'] != 'OK':
    pass

with open('/etc/hostname', 'r') as file:
    old_hostname = file.read().replace('\n','')

hostname = msg['hostname']
if len(hostname) < 4 :
    msg['payload'] = ' '
    msg['topic'] = 'ERROR - Hostname NOT changed'
    return msg
    

with open('/etc/hostname', 'w+') as file:
    file.write(hostname)
os.system('echo ' + hostname + ' | tee /etc/hostname')
with open('/etc/hosts', 'r') as file:
    temp = file.read()
temp = temp.replace(old_hostname,hostname)
with open('/etc/hosts', 'w') as file:
    file.write(temp)
os.system('hostnamectl set-hostname ' + hostname)
os.system('systemctl restart avahi-daemon')
save('hostname',hostname)
msg['payload'] = hostname
msg['topic'] = 'Success - Hostname changed'
return msg

name: msg
func:
if (msg.payload === 'Cancel'){
    return
}
msg.forename = msg.payload
msg.topic = 'OpenScanCloud Registration (3/3)'
msg.payload = 'Enter your last name'
return msg

name: OSC
payload:
Files&Cloud

Refresh

You can refresh the status of the processing of your files in the OpenScanCloud. Make sure to read and agree the terms of use (in settings menu) before using the OpenScanCloud. Do not spam this button, as this might lead to temporary/permanent suspension of your IP address.

The status (in the table) of the individual sets in the file list will be updated to one of the following:

Created - you started the upload of your image set. If you are stuck on this status, please try to restart the upload.

Initialized - all files have been uploaded and processing will start as soon as possible

File approved - the server received and verified your files

Processing started - your files are currently being processed

Processing failed - there are various reasons why processing might fail. Please check the email for more details or contact me at cloud@openscan.eu

processing done - check your email, where you should find a link to the 3d model :)

Status (on the right column)

Indicates, what the device is currently up to.

Refreshing - updating all image set's status

Uploading - while transferring the image set to the OpenScanCloud servers. If the upload freezes, be patient. If nothing happens, reboot the device and restart the upload.

Project started - when the upload of a set was successful

Zipping - files larger then 200mb have to be split and re-zipped before uploading to the OpenScanCloud, the process might take a while depending on the filesize.

Combining - two sets into one might take up to a minute.

Set

select a set from the file list by clicking on a row in the table

Download

Download the selected set from the OpenScan device to your computer/mobile/tablet

Upload

Upload the selected file to the OpenScanCloud

Combine

In order to combine two sets, select one set. Click the combine button and select the second set. A pop-up will appear, and you can confirm the operation. All images from the two sets will be merged into one set. The original image sets will be deleted!

Delete Set/All

Please keep in mind, that the memory of the SD card is relatively small, and thus you will have to delete individual or all photo sets from time to time.

name: Scan_settings
payload:
Scan Settings

Current Status

--READY-- - everything is okay and ready to go :)

Routine-preparing - before starting the routine some time might pass depending on the number of photos

Routine-stopping - manually ending the routine by pressing the stop button

Routine-Photo X/Y - Showing the progress of the routine

No Camera Found - please check the camera ribbon cable

Error: XXX - Please contact info@openscan.eu or post an issue on Github.com

Projectname

Each photo set will be saved using the following pattern  YYYY-MM-DD_hh-mm-ss_projectname.zip (e.g. 2022-04-05_12.12.12_toysoldier.zip). Keep your files organized by giving each set a new projectname. If not specified 'default' will be used.

Rotor

Moving the rotor by increments of 5°. Please make sure to start the routine with the camera in the horizontal position.

Turntable

Moving the turntable by increments of 15°.

Ringlight

Use the ring light for shadow-free illumination. It is highly recommended to use the polarizer in order to avoid reflections. Note, that the polarizer will absorb 75% of the light, so you might need to use both ring lights.

Photos

Set the number of photos for the current set. 60-120 photos should be more than enough for most objects. If the reconstruction fails or is very bad with 60 photos, increasing the number of photos will not help!

Shutter

Again: Less is more! If the value is too high, some areas might get overexposed and thus, the software will not be able to recognize the surface feature of the object. Here are some reference values:

- no polarizer: 5-20ms

- mostly white object,  with polarizer + one ringlight: 50-200ms

Crop X/Y

Make sure to use the right object holder to place the object in the middle of the screen. Try to crop as many unnecessary areas as possible. This will greatly lower the file size and resulting transfer and reconstruction times!

Start/Stop

Use the buttons to start/stop the routine

Reboot/Shutdown

In case of an error, try to restart the device. Always use the shutdown button before powering-off the device!

name: msg
loadB
write
Update&Info
payload:
Update&Log

Status

See whether new updates are available. It is highly recommended to use the latest firmware version. See OpenScan2 on Github.com for details and the source code.

Updatetype

- stable: latest well-tested and mostly bug-free version for the OpenScanMini or Classic and various cameras

- beta: stable version + some experimental and new features, which might bring joy and some new bugs as well

- mini: very simplified firmware for the OpenScanMini + Arducam IMX519

Auto-Check update availability

Perform an automated update-check after each start of the device. If the device is connected to the internet, it will get the latest files from OpenScan2 on Github.com

This option is activated by default.

Check Updates

Alternatively, you can check for updates manually at any time by pressing this button.

Download Error Log

In case you encounter any errors with your device, please download the error log text and send a copy to info@openscan.eu or create an issue on Github.com

get update
func:
import json
import requests
from OpenScan import load_str

if not msg['payload']:
    msg['status'] = '--READY--'
    return msg

updatepath = '/home/pi/OpenScan/updates/'
url = 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/OpenScanEu/OpenScan2/main/update/'
updatepath_temp = updatepath + 'update_temp.json'
updatepath_old = updatepath + 'update.json'

r = requests.get(url + 'update.json')

if r.status_code != 200:
    msg['status'] = 'no internet connection'
    return msg

with open(updatepath_temp, 'wb+') as file:
    file.write(r.content)
with open(updatepath_temp, 'r') as file:
    msg = json.load(file)

msg['status'] = 'checking updates'

return msg, msg

name: check files
func:
import json
import requests
import shutil
from OpenScan import load_str

scope = load_str('update_type')
msg['scope'] = scope

updatepath = '/home/pi/OpenScan/updates/'
url = 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/OpenScanEu/OpenScan2/main/update/'
updatepath_old = updatepath + 'update.json'

counter = 0
for i in msg[scope]:
    filepath = msg[scope][i]['dst']
    temp = updatepath + os.path.basename(filepath)
    if os.path.isfile(temp):
        filesize = os.path.getsize(temp)
        msg[scope][i]['filesize2'] = filesize
        if filesize == msg[scope][i]['filesize']:
            msg[scope][i]['update'] = False
            continue
    msg[scope][i]['update'] = True

    counter += 1

if counter == 0:
    msg['status'] = 'No new update available'
else:
    msg['status'] = 'New update available'
    msg['topic'] = msg['status']
    msg['payload'] = 'Install & reboot now?'

msg['counter'] = counter

return msg

name: loadS
write
loadB
write
download files
func:
import json
import requests
import shutil
from OpenScan import load_str, save


scope = msg['scope']

updatepath = '/home/pi/OpenScan/updates/'
url = 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/OpenScanEu/OpenScan2/main/update/'

if msg['payload'] != 'YES':
    return

counter = 0

for i in msg[scope]:
    if msg[scope][i]['update'] == False:
        continue
    
    filepath = msg[scope][i]['dst']
    temp = updatepath + os.path.basename(filepath)
    
    r = requests.get(url + msg[scope][i]['src'])
    if r.status_code != 200:
        msg['status'] = 'downloading ' + msg[scope][i]['src'] + ' failed'
        return msg
    with open(temp, 'wb+') as file:
        file.write(r.content)
    shutil.copy(temp, msg[scope][i]['dst'])
    
    if msg[scope][i]['dst'] == '/boot/config.txt':
        save('camera','')
    
    counter += 1

msg['status'] = 'Installed ' + str(counter) + ' of ' + str(msg['counter']) + ' - restarting ...'

if counter == msg['counter']:
    updatepath_temp = updatepath + 'update_temp.json'
    updatepath_old = updatepath + 'update.json'
    shutil.move(updatepath_temp, updatepath_old)

return msg

name: msg
loadB
msg
func:
from subprocess import getoutput
import os

msg['os'] = getoutput("cat /etc/os-release | grep -i 'PRETTY_NAME'")[13:-1]
msg['device'] = getoutput("cat /proc/device-tree/model")
msg['flask'] = getoutput("systemctl status flask |grep -i 'Active:'").split(' ')[6]
msg['osdate'] = getoutput("vcgencmd version").split('\n')[0]
msg['temp'] = getoutput("vcgencmd measure_temp").split('=')[1]
cpu_total = getoutput("free -m | head -n2 | tail -n1 |awk '{print $2}'")
cpu_used = getoutput("free -m | head -n2 | tail -n1 |awk '{print $3}'")
swap_total = getoutput("free -m | head -n3 | tail -n1 |awk '{print $2}'")
swap_used = getoutput("free -m | head -n3 | tail -n1 |awk '{print $3}'")
diskspace_used = getoutput("df -h / | tail -n1 |awk '{print $3}'")
diskspace_total = getoutput("df -h / | tail -n1 |awk '{print $2}'")

msg['cpu'] = cpu_used + '/' + cpu_total + 'MB'
msg['swap'] = swap_used + '/' + swap_total + 'MB'
msg['diskspace'] =diskspace_used + '/' + diskspace_total

if msg['flask'] == 'inactive':
    os.system('systemctl restart flask')

return msg

name: create beta new
func:
import json
import requests
import shutil

#scope = 'main'
scope = 'betaARDU'

updatepath = '/home/pi/OpenScan/tmp/'
url = 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/OpenScanEu/OpenScan2/main/update/'
updatepath_temp = updatepath + 'update_temp.json'
updatepath_old = updatepath + 'update.json'


## load update.json
r = requests.get(url + 'update.json')

if r.status_code != 200:
    msg['status'] = 'download update.json failed'
    return msg

msg = {}
with open(updatepath_temp, 'wb+') as file:
    file.write(r.content)
with open(updatepath_temp, 'r') as file:
    msg = json.load(file)

msg2 = msg.copy()
if scope in msg:
    del msg[scope]

msg[scope]={}
msg[scope]['1'] = {}
msg[scope]['1']['src'] = scope + '/fla.py'
msg[scope]['1']['dst'] = '/home/pi/OpenScan/files/fla.py'

msg[scope]['2'] = {}
msg[scope]['2']['src'] = scope + '/Arducam.py'
msg[scope]['2']['dst'] = '/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/Arducam.py'

msg[scope]['3'] = {}
msg[scope]['3']['src'] = scope + '/OpenScan.py'
msg[scope]['3']['dst'] = '/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/OpenScan.py'

msg[scope]['4'] = {}
msg[scope]['4']['src'] = scope + '/config.txt'
msg[scope]['4']['dst'] = '/boot/config.txt'

msg[scope]['5'] = {}
msg[scope]['5']['src'] = scope + '/flows.json'
msg[scope]['5']['dst'] = '/home/pi/OpenScan/settings/.node-red/flows.json'

msg[scope]['6'] = {}
msg[scope]['6']['src'] = scope + '/settings.js'
msg[scope]['6']['dst'] = '/root/.node-red/settings.js'

msg[scope]['7'] = {}
msg[scope]['7']['src'] = 'files/logo.jpg'
msg[scope]['7']['dst'] = '/home/pi/OpenScan/files/logo.jpg'

for i in msg[scope]:
    filepath = msg[scope][i]['dst']
    filesize = os.path.getsize(filepath)
    msg[scope][i]['filesize'] = filesize

if os.path.isdir('/home/pi/OpenScan/tmp/update/'):
    os.system('rm -r /home/pi/OpenScan/tmp/update')    
os.makedirs('/home/pi/OpenScan/tmp/update/')

with open('/home/pi/OpenScan/tmp/update/update.json', 'w+') as f:
    json.dump(msg, f, indent=4)

for i in msg[scope]:
    if not os.path.isdir(os.path.dirname('/home/pi/OpenScan/tmp/update/' + msg[scope][i]['src'])):
        os.makedirs(os.path.dirname('/home/pi/OpenScan/tmp/update/' + msg[scope][i]['src']))
    shutil.copy(msg[scope][i]['dst'], '/home/pi/OpenScan/tmp/update/' + msg[scope][i]['src'])

msg['payload'] = 'created with scope: ' + scope

return msg

prepare image creation
func:
import os

#factory reset, reset wpa, create wpa in boot, rm files
#should be done before creating a new raspbian image

basepath = '/home/pi/OpenScan/'

#remove files

dir = basepath + 'scans/'

for i in ['scans/','tmp/']:
    os.system('rm -r ' + basepath + i)
    os.mkdir(basepath + i)

#delete wifi
temp_dir = '/home/pi/OpenScan/tmp/wpa_empty.log'
wpa_dir = '/etc/wpa_supplicant/wpa_supplicant.conf'

with open(temp_dir, 'w+') as file:
    file.write('update_config=1\nctrl_interface=DIR=/var/run/wpa_supplicant\ncountry=de\n\n')
os.system('mv '+ temp_dir + ' ' + wpa_dir)
os.system('wpa_cli -i wlan0 reconfigure')

#create new wpa_supplicant.conf
with open('/boot/wpa_supplicant.conf','w+') as file:
    file.write('country=de\nupdate_config=1\nctrl_interface=/var/run/wpa_supplicant\n\nnetwork={\n scan_ssid=1\n ssid="wlan name"\n psk="xxxx"\n}')
os.system("chmod a+rwx /boot/wpa_supplicant.conf")


#rm tmp dir


#stop photos:
os.system('systemctl stop flask')
os.system('rm -r ' + basepath + 'tmp')
os.system('mkdir ' + basepath + 'tmp')

os.system('systemctl stop nodered')

#reset factory
